image.altText: A young girl using a walking aid, smiling as a woman nearby blows bubbles.

props.synopsis: The National Disability Insurance Agency is cutting travel allowances for physiotherapists, which some parents say will disadvantage their children living with disabilities — especially in regional and remote areas.

title.children: NDIS cuts to leave regional kids with less access to vital physiotherapy

image.altText: The Mayor Matt Paterson, wearing a white shirt sits at a table with a bell in the forefront.

props.synopsis: Matt Paterson campaigned as a "boring" mayor, but his term in a troubled part of Australia has been anything but dull — from wearing budgie smugglers at the airport, to regularly fronting national news and even calling for the sacking of the entire NT government.

title.children: 'There's no rule book': Alice Springs mayor to step down after eventful term

image.altText: Peter Wellman James on a beach.

props.synopsis: Darwin drug baron Peter Wellman James, who's now in prison for supplying drugs, was running a fleet of ATMs despite a prior 2012 conviction.

title.children: Darwin's biggest drug dealer owned network of private ATMs

image.altText: Cuts of beef sit displayed in a butcher.

props.synopsis: Less than a decade after the red meat industry promised to reach net-zero emissions by 2030, it abandons the goal claiming it is not possible.

title.children: Cattle industry walks away from net-zero target by 2030 pledge

props.synopsis: Organisers of an event to promote women's safety are disappointed and shocked after several women reported inappropriate behaviour while participating in the Take Back the Track run on Wednesday night.

title.children: Women assaulted on safety fun run in Alice Springs

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood celebrates

props.synopsis: A stunning Josh Hazlewood spell of 4-5 in five overs has earned Australia victory inside three days of the first Test in Barbados.

title.children: Australia claims remarkable victory off the back of Hazlewood heroics

image.altText: Boy running hand along fence

props.synopsis: A 13-year-old boy was left languishing in a homeless shelter for months because of Tasmanian child protection department's "gross negligence", a family member says.

title.children: Family of 13yo left at homeless shelter for months worry he won't live past his childhood

image.altText: Mechelle Turvey and Stephen Cleal hug outside court.

props.synopsis: After three years, a national outcry, and the sentencing of her son's murderers, Mechelle Turvey is still a force for change.

title.children: It took years to sentence her son's killers. Mechelle Turvey knew the truth

image.altText: A gloved hand holds a bag of frozen frogs.

props.synopsis: Meat and seafood producers are calling for tougher biosecurity penalties after a woman avoided a prison term for illegally importing 62,000kg of meat, fish and insect-infested fruit from Thailand.

title.children: Industry aghast as black marketeer avoids jail for 62-tonne food import

image.altText: Lauren Sanchez in a floral wedding dress and Jeff Bezos in a suit.

props.synopsis: The sky itself is no limit for billionaire Jeff Bezos and fiancée Lauren Sánchez and expectations were about as high ahead of their wedding in Venice.

title.children: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's Venice wedding in pictures

image.altText: Humanoid robots box in China

props.synopsis: China is now competing with the United States in the race to find a breakthrough moment with machines set to transform economies.

title.children: China vies to win humanoid robot race against US

image.altText: People carrying white bags over their heads as they walk in front of a damaged building

props.synopsis: Israeli strike hits a street where witnesses said people were getting bags of flour from a Palestinian police unit that had confiscated the goods from looters.

title.children: Israel's military orders probe into possible war crimes after deaths near Gaza aid sites

image.altText: She sits on a bench by the sea and looks at the ocean

props.synopsis: Jayde Guest spends most evenings lying on the couch in excruciating pain. Frustrated by the health system, she has taken matters into her own hands.

title.children: Woman who had bone cancer 20 years ago says chronic pain fight even worse

image.altText: A woman in a white jumper is holding a book open, smiling

props.synopsis: It's a story that became Aussie folklore, but for the descendants of those involved, the ripple effects of that frosty night 145 years ago would be felt for generations.

title.children: Fallout from Ned Kelly's last stand haunted families for generations

image.altText: Banded stilts in flight near Lake Eyre.

props.synopsis: With Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre expecting its most significant fill in decades, hundreds of thousands of migratory birds are flocking to the inland oasis, but how they know the rare event is happening is an "enduring mystery".

title.children: How birds know when Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre is full remains a mystery

image.altText: mum and daughter sit on the floor

props.synopsis: Families of children living with a disability in regional and remote areas fear their kids may lose their independence due to cuts to NDIS provider rates.

title.children: NDIS travel cuts could leave kids in regional areas without care

image.altText: An unidentified person rolls a suitcase and carries a coles bag through the Brisbane Airport.

props.synopsis: Do you really know what your travel insurance covers? We spoke to the experts to find out exactly what you're entitled to when a conflict breaks or a natural disaster unfolds.

title.children: Going on a big trip? Here's what your travel insurance might not cover

image.altText: A person trying on a pink dressing gown

props.synopsis: As the first month of winter is almost over, we ask ABC readers to share their tips on how to save money without sacrificing comfort.

title.children: Setting the heater to 25C to keep out the winter chill? That may be costing you more

image.altText: Sydney player Joel Amartey has his arms outstreched in celebration and an open mouthed smile.

props.synopsis: Brandon Walker, Joel Amartey, Isaac Quaynor and Connor Idun all have a rich Ghanaian heritage that's shaping the way they play.

title.children: The Ghanaian-Australian quartet making a mark on the AFL

image.altText: A man in a black “Tathra Place” cap and farm jacket sits inside a barn filled with ducklings.

props.synopsis: Former Sydney electrician Luke Winder has built one of Australia's largest free-range duck farms on the Southern Tablelands of New South Wales, after teaching himself regenerative farming via YouTube.

title.children: Electrician with no ag experience now runs thriving duck farm

image.altText: Two men on a sofa smile at each as one bottle feeds a baby on his lap.

props.synopsis: With more Australians finding surrogate mothers overseas, parents and lawyers are calling for an overhaul of Australia's "patchwork" laws, while some ethicists say paying for babies should remain illegal.

title.children: Should Australia have a babies-for-profit industry? Some think so

image.altText: Two women work together to put a cast on the leg of a young boy as he lays on a medical stretcher playing with toys.

props.synopsis: Canberra therapy providers say looming changes to the National Disability Insurance Scheme are "devastating", forcing some to reduce their fees and leaving others staring down another year with no price increase.

title.children: NDIS pricing changes 'devastating', Canberra therapy providers say

image.altText: Three brown paper bags with canteen lunch orders written on them.

props.synopsis: Writing your school lunch order on a brown paper bag may be a thing of the past. School canteens still rely on the goodwill of volunteers and advocates say more funding is needed to keep the roller door open.

title.children: School canteen orders may be thing of the past as rising costs bite

image.altText: longevity stock

props.synopsis: Over time, the chemical processes that allow our body to function, known as our "metabolic activity", lead to damage and a decline in the activity of our cells, tissues and organs.

title.children: People are spending hundreds on 'biological age' tests. Are they worth it?

image.altText: A composite image showing eight book covers on a blue and purple background

props.synopsis: A queer thriller, new novels from some of Australia's biggest authors and luminous short stories are all on offer this month in our critics' top picks. They'll take you from South London to New Zealand to a post-apocalyptic future — and beyond.

title.children: The books our critics couldn't put down in June

image.altText: Female hikers walking on a rocky forest trail surrounded by tall trees and greenery.

props.synopsis: A growing number of women say they want community, physical activity and time outdoors — just without the gasps for air that come with trying to chat mid-run.

title.children: Women turn to alternatives to running for 'outdoorsy' group exercise

image.altText: Trump and Xi shake hands with the American and Chinese flags in the background

props.synopsis: China has confirmed the details of the framework will include Washington looking at "restrictive measures", while Beijing will "review and approve" items under export control.

title.children: US, China confirm trade deal framework after months-long tariff war

image.altText: Nic White of the Western Force about to catch a rugby ball which is comng towards him at chest height

props.synopsis: It has been 12 long years in the making, and Nic White has said it will be a dream come true when he gets his chance to play against the British and Irish Lions on Saturday night.

title.children: 'Don't get injured': White's 12-year wait to play the Lions ends

image.altText: Ross Willis holding a magazine of him modelling for Rundles

props.synopsis: A flick through some old magazines took Ross Willis and his daughter through a "time warp" to the days when he was a teen model, and suit tailors thrived in Newcastle.

title.children: 'He was a very handsome guy': Back to the days when Grandad was hot

image.altText: A man squats in long grass with a very large crocodile in the foreground, facing away from him.

props.synopsis: Removals of problem crocs from the wild have been on an upward trend since 2020 and hit a record high last year, but one grazier has an innovative approach to ease the crocodile housing crunch.

title.children: Even crocodiles need real estate. That's when Jesse Crampton steps in

image.altText: Maya Joint clenches her fist and smiles after winning a match at the Eastbourne Open

props.synopsis: Maya Joint has continued her extraordinary rise, reaching the final of another WTA event at the age of just 19.

title.children: Joint into Eastbourne Open final as teenager's Wimbledon prospects grow

image.altText: A close up selfie of a woman wearing a cap and headphones

props.synopsis: Former reality TV contestant Tamika Chesser, who has been charged with the murder of her partner, has appeared in court. SA Police say they are yet to locate some of the man's remains. Warning: This story contains details some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Beauty and the Geek contestant accused of murder, police search for missing remains

image.altText: A black and white close-up of Anna Wintour in a diamond necklace, jacket with her signature bob and dark sunglasses

props.synopsis: As Anna Wintour steps down as editor of US Vogue after almost 40 years in the role, one thing seems clear: her legacy is as astonishing as her rise.

title.children: Anna Wintour redefined fashion. Her legacy is as astonishing as her rise
